step.para: In the side navigation menu, choose Code, and then choose Source repositories.
Choose the name of the repository from the list of source repositories for the project.

tip.para: You can filter the list of repositories by typing part of the repository name in the filter bar.

step.para: If you do not have a personal access token (PAT), choose Create token. Copy the token and save it in a secure location. You will use this PAT when prompted for a password by your Git client or integrated development environment (IDE).
Choose Clone repository. Copy the clone URL for the repository.

listitem.para: If you are cloning a repository to your local computer, open a terminal or command line and run the git clone command, and paste the clone URL after the command. For example:
When prompted for a password, paste the PAT you saved earlier.

note.para: If your operating system provides credential management or you have installed a credential management system, you will only need to provide this PAT once. If not, you might have to provide the PAT for all Git operations to the source repository. As a best practice, make sure that your credential management system securely stores your PAT. Do not manually provide the PAT as part of the clone URL string.

listitem.para: If you are cloning a repository using an IDE, your experience will vary depending on the IDE. Choose the option to clone a Git repository and provide the URL. When prompted for a password, provide the PAT. For more information about how to clone a Git repository using your IDE, see the documentation for the IDE.
